label: 日嗣御子
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: The heir apparent to the Great King's throne. When the term came into use is unclear. It first appears in Kōgyoku's chapter of the Nihon shoki, and usage continues in eighth-century oral edicts (semmyō). [皇極、日本書紀、宣命]
